google_play_reviews.content: It works as advertised, if you want the premier way to learn Japanese on your phone, this is it.

nice app, but it didn't really work if the word is too small or there is other mismatch color on the word background PS : Can you add romaji? pretty please! there is some of us who can read romaji but can't read japanese xD no i learn them...but not kanji...arrgh those kanji...!!!! thanks for replying. i just mean the section where we click the word will show how to read that word... because using kaku may separate the word that means for one word for example name. welll...thanks.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Screen resolution/DPI plays a factor in Kaku's ability to read smaller text, as it is OCR-based.

I'm still not sure if I understand you. You are saying instead of: 花簪 (はなかんざし) in the dictionary you want to see 花簪 (hanakanzashi) right?

google_play_reviews.content: This app is absolutely fantastic, I've been looking for something like it for a while. Do you accept donations?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks! I currently don't take donations or have a paid version as I prefer to remain anonymous on the internet (Play Store forces indie developers to list their real home address for everyone to see if they want to sell something). I may eventually get a PO box with real street address though for the removal of the one ad in the start screen.

google_play_reviews.content: Really great app that helps you learning and practicing the language while using other Japanese apps or games. Love it.

For a long time I've been switching between apps trying to find anything close to Rikai that I could use on my phone, your app is exactly what was missing, so thank you for putting it out! I've been using it for the past few hours playing a Japanese game on my phone and I don't think I've encountered any problems so far. The transition between using the app and playing the game hasn't interfered with the gaming experience. Can't wait use Kaku on more occasions!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks! If you know other people who'd benefit from Kaku, please do share it with them!
